meta.tooltip: Metrics: Job Growth (High), Tech Adoption (Rapid). Key focus on precision ag and value addition.

context.interviewQuestion: Describe a time you used data to improve a crop yield or farm process.

steps.title: Foundations: Agronomy Basics
steps.desc: Understand crop cycles, soil health, and basic farm management.

steps.title: Core Skills: GIS & Drone Ops
steps.desc: Learn to use GPS tools, fly drones for mapping, and interpret aerial data.

steps.title: Certification: Remote Sensing
steps.desc: Gain proficiency in analyzing satellite imagery for crop health monitoring.

steps.title: Service Provision
steps.desc: Set up a service model to offer precision insights to local farmers.

occupations.skillsDescription: Delivers mobile advisory services to farmers. Creates and disseminates digital advisory content.
occupations.whyInDemand: Rapid growth in digital agriculture tools (apps, e-extension, fintech, data services) is explicitly positioned as a youth jobs pathway.

occupations.skillsDescription: Uses GPS/GIS to optimize field variability. Analyzes satellite/drone imagery to create variable rate prescription maps.
occupations.whyInDemand: Precision services (including drone-assisted approaches) are highlighted as a frontier for youth-led service provision in agri-food systems.

occupations.skillsDescription: Operates UAVs for crop surveillance and mapping. Plans complex flight missions and processes raw imagery.
occupations.whyInDemand: High demand for aerial surveillance and precision mapping in large-scale plantations and for smallholder clustering.

occupations.skillsDescription: Interprets soil samples for nutrient management. Uses statistical software to analyze soil data trends.
occupations.whyInDemand: Critical for optimizing fertilizer use and soil health, directly impacting yield and sustainability.

occupations.skillsDescription: Operates mechanization equipment and spraying drones. Delivers services via platform models.
occupations.whyInDemand: Rising demand for spraying and mechanization services delivered via platform models (e.g., service booking).

occupations.skillsDescription: Installs and maintains water-saving irrigation systems. Manages on-farm water management technologies.
occupations.whyInDemand: Climate-smart practice adoption is pushing roles around water-saving irrigation and on-farm water management.

occupations.skillsDescription: Operates processing machinery for value addition. Manages packaging and small-scale manufacturing lines.
occupations.whyInDemand: Agro-processing is repeatedly emphasized as a job-creation engine (processing hubs, packaging, product development).

occupations.skillsDescription: Manages packhouse operations and cold-chain logistics. Reduces losses through proper storage and handling.
occupations.whyInDemand: High losses linked to poor storage/handling create strong demand for practical post-harvest and logistics skills.

occupations.skillsDescription: Manages pond/cage operations and feeding. Maintains water quality and production records.
occupations.whyInDemand: Countries like Kenya are explicitly scaling aquaculture to close large supply gaps and grow employment/income.

occupations.skillsDescription: Monitors fishing activities and enforces regulations. Conducts catch assessments and data collection.
occupations.whyInDemand: Fisheries agencies emphasize compliance/enforcement, responses to IUU fishing, and scaling technical capacity.

skills.narrative: Modern soil analysis involves using digital spectrometers and lab data to map nutrient variability (N-P-K) across a farm.
Deploying and maintaining networks of sensors that monitor soil moisture, temperature, and humidity in real-time.
Visualizing farm data layers—such as yield history, topography, and soil type—on a map.
Analyzing large datasets (yield data, weather patterns) and building predictive models for pest outbreaks.
Integrating mobile money (M-Pesa, MTN Mobile Money) is essential for agri-fintech.
Agri-logistics focuses on the cold chain and efficient movement of perishable goods.
Using historical weather data and AI models to predict seasonal shifts.
Analyzing satellite (Sentinel-2) or drone imagery to assess crop health (NDVI indices).
Managing input supplies (seeds, fertilizer) and harvest stock using digital ledgers.
Translating complex agronomic data into simple, actionable visual dashboards.
Deep understanding of plant physiology and genetics, combined with digital tools.
Piloting UAVs for crop spraying or multispectral imaging.

steps.title: Foundations: Electrical Safety
steps.desc: Understand basic electrical circuits, safety standards (OSHA), and tool handling.

steps.title: Core Skills: PV Systems & Wiring
steps.desc: Learn to install solar panels, inverters, and battery storage systems.

steps.title: Certification: EPRA T1/T2 License
steps.desc: Prepare for and pass the national regulatory licensing exam for solar technicians.

steps.title: Field Experience
steps.desc: Log required hours under a licensed contractor to gain full accreditation.

occupations.skillsDescription: Assembles and maintains photovoltaic systems. Wires DC components and connects inverters.
occupations.whyInDemand: Rapid off-grid and commercial solar adoption requires certified installers.

occupations.skillsDescription: Ensures transmission stability and load balance. Runs grid simulation models to analyze impact.
occupations.whyInDemand: Grid modernization and stability projects are increasing across the region.

occupations.skillsDescription: Inspects buildings for efficiency improvements. Analyzes energy consumption data and calculates ROI.
occupations.whyInDemand: New energy efficiency regulations for large buildings drive demand.

occupations.skillsDescription: Operates steam extraction and generation plant. Troubleshoots mechanical or electrical faults.
occupations.whyInDemand: Expansion of geothermal capacity in Rift Valley creates technical roles.

occupations.skillsDescription: Troubleshoots and repairs turbine components. Performs composite repairs on blades.
occupations.whyInDemand: Large-scale wind farms need O&M technicians.

occupations.skillsDescription: Evaluates regulations and tariff frameworks. Models financial impact of different tariff structures.
occupations.whyInDemand: Regulatory reforms and tariff structuring require policy expertise.

occupations.skillsDescription: Services Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI). Troubleshoots communication issues between meters.
occupations.whyInDemand: Utility companies are rolling out smart metering infrastructure.

occupations.skillsDescription: Oversees renewable construction lifecycles. Manages budget and schedule for projects.
occupations.whyInDemand: Complex renewable energy projects require specialized management.

occupations.skillsDescription: Enforces HSE standards and compliance. Conducts formal site safety audits.
occupations.whyInDemand: Strict HSE compliance enforcement in energy projects.

occupations.skillsDescription: Manages biomass conversion systems. Adjusts feedstock recipes to optimize gas production.
occupations.whyInDemand: Clean cooking and biogas initiatives are scaling up.

skills.narrative: Fundamental ability to interpret circuit diagrams and safely install AC/DC wiring, specifically high-voltage DC cabling.
Designing and installing Photovoltaic (PV) systems, including load calculation and component selection.
Monitoring real-time power flows and detecting faults remotely in modern grid systems.
Analyzing building or industrial energy usage to identify wastage and recommend retrofits.
Strict adherence to safety standards (Lockout/Tagout, PPE) is non-negotiable.
Using CAD software to create precise electrical schematics and site layout plans.
Managing the stability of the electrical grid and integrating intermittent renewable sources.
Coordinating timelines, budgets, and procurement for energy projects.
Understanding heat flow is crucial for geothermal energy and solar water heating systems.
Navigating the complex landscape of energy laws, tariffs, and environmental regulations.
Analyzing smart meter data to understand consumption patterns and detect theft.
Hands-on troubleshooting of hardware in remote locations.
Technical skills required for the installation and maintenance of wind turbines.
Understanding the infrastructure of power transmission, including substations and transformers.

occupations.whyInDemand: Emerging applications in fintech, agritech, and healthtech.
